abstract: Under pressure because of costly delays, Lockheed said it would probably build the planes under a fixed-price contract.
snippet: Under pressure because of costly delays, Lockheed said it would probably build the planes under a fixed-price contract.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Lockheed Martin is negotiating to cut the price for the next group of its new F-35 fighter planes to at least 20 percent less than Pentagon officials projected last fall, Robert J. Stevens, the chief executive, said Thursday.

headline.main: Lockheed in Talks to Reduce Price of F-35 Planes by 20%
headline.print_headline: Lockheed in Talks to Reduce Price of F-35 Planes by 20%

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
